instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R? This is a power rail between the battery and a current sense resistor before the battery power feeds current to the rest of the machine. .
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not turn on from battery power
threads.message: bit of an odd one which im sure im missing something but banging my head so thought id put it out there, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not power on with battery power, now its not the keyboard the laptop will switch on and off fine with the mains connected , will even run from the battery once on, will even charge the battery but if i disconnect the mains and shut down it wont power on again, now i do have 8v at <CAPACITOR>C7116</CAPACITOR> "<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_R</SIGNAL> and same at <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> also measure 2.2 and 0 ohms, ive changed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> just for the hell of it and no joy . What am i missing ?? any help would be great

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not turn on from battery power
threads.message:
"if i disconnect the mains and shut down it wont power on again"
Just to be sure, machine stays on if unplug charger, but doesn't turn on with battery alone?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not turn on from battery power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not turn on from battery power
threads.message:
Did you try another battery?
PRAM reset done?

Try pressing power button for 2-3s...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not turn on from battery power
threads.message: yes tried all of that :-( think im going mad

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not turn on from battery power
threads.message: Check RTC signals on battery alone.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> will not turn on from battery power
threads.message: ok , dont know how this is possible but the problem was the trackpad cable in the end, very slight corrosion on the cable but why this stopped the laptop from turning on via battery power is a mystery
